angles.headline: Sources: The 'Unified Command' Friction Behind the Scenes
angles.angle: While the press release sings 'unity' between SF, San Mateo, and Santa Clara agencies, my sources on the ground describe a turf war over motorcade jurisdiction. The 'handshake' protocols for team buses crossing county lines are still being debated, which is unheard of this close to kickoff. If they don't resolve the comms channel dispute, we could see a team bus stalled at a county line for 'security verification'.

local_angles.angle: The Tasman Trap: Surviving Phase II/III Closures
local_angles.description: The City just dropped the hammer: Tasman Drive is locked down from Jan 28 to Feb 13 (Phase II & III). If you usually drive down Tasman to get to the Green Lot, you're driving into a wall. We're mapping the survival routes for locals and visitors alike.
venues: VTA Great America Station (The only way through)
Lick Mill Blvd (The secret back road)
San Tomas Aquino Creek Trail (The walking bypass)
local_angles.insider_tip: Forget rideshare drop-offs at the front gate. Have your driver drop you at the Mercado center on Mission College Blvd. Grab a burger, then walk the Creek Trail north. You bypass the entire Tasman gridlock.
local_angles.fan_hook: The map you used last year is worthless. Here is how to beat the Phase III lockdown.

local_angles.angle: Eating on the Edge: Dining Outside the Security Zone
local_angles.description: With the 'Soft Perimeter' going up, delivery drivers (UberEats, DoorDash) are getting turned away at checkpoints. You need to eat where the roads are still open. We're highlighting the best spots just outside the security cordon in Santa Clara Square and Rivermark.
venues: Il Fornaio (Santa Clara Square - Pre-game carb load)
Puesto (Santa Clara Square - Tacos before kickoff)
local_angles.insider_tip: Santa Clara Square is the sweet spot. It's walkable to the stadium (20 mins) but completely outside the vehicle checkpoints. Park there early, eat well, and walk in.
local_angles.fan_hook: Don't get trapped in a food desert. Here is where to feast before you breach the perimeter.

local_angles.description: The 'Infrastructure Impact' isn't just bureaucratic speak—it means the media compound has eaten half of Blue Lot 1. We're breaking down where the real tailgate action is shifting for SB60.
local_angles.insider_tip: If you have a Blue Lot pass, check the map again. The broadcast trucks have taken the prime spots near the gate. Shift your setup to the back rows of Green Lot 3 for more space and less hassle from security patrols.
